summary: This document is an email chain from August 27, 2021, regarding the saving of notes (possibly interview or investigative notes) into specific folders (3500 and witness folders) on a shared drive related to the Epstein case. The correspondence involves a contractor and a detective from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Contractor
persons.context: A contractor is instructed to save attached notes into specific folders on the Epstein share drive.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: A detective from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force is the original sender of the notes being forwarded for saving.

connections.person2: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: The contractor is receiving instructions to handle documents (notes) originating from the detective.

events.title: Email regarding Epstein case notes
events.description: An email chain instructs a contractor to save attached investigative notes into the '3500 and witness folders' on the Epstein share drive.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 27, 2021, showing ongoing case management related to the Epstein investigation.
It references specific folders named '3500' and 'witness folders' on a shared drive dedicated to the Epstein case.
The correspondence involves a member of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The attachment was scanned and sent from a Xerox multifunction printer located at 290 Broadway in New York City.
